thread.title: Former Sioux Falls Car Dealer Sentenced
thread.title_full: Former Sioux Falls Car Dealer Sentenced

title: Former Sioux Falls Car Dealer Sentenced
text:
Former Sioux Falls Car Dealer Sentenced October 21, 2015, 2:12 PM File Photo SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
The former owner of Moto Joes has been sentenced for deceptive business practices. 
Attorney general spokesperson Sara Rabern said 38-year-old Joseph Matthew Stanford, of Brandon, was sentenced on one count of selling a motor vehicle without the consent of lienholder. 
Previous Story: Man Comes Forward Following Questionable Car Deal 
Stanford received 2 years of probation, and 120 days of jail time with 90 days suspended. He is also barred from selling vehicles or working as an auto manager for 2 years. 
The case was investigated by the South Dakota Department of Revenue - Division of Motor Vehicles, the Attorney General's Consumer Protection Division, and the Division of Criminal Investigation. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
